title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Have a late 2012 820-3302 imac come in for SSD upgrade. Original hard drive defective and needing replacement. During reassembly technician droped screen while unit had power which blew L9100. Replaced screen and  L9100 and have picture again but whenever the imac is turned off or in sleep mode the fan spins fast constantly. Everything works perfect including normal fan speed while its running. Checked and everything is plugged in properly.

Could the fan be spinning fast while its turned off or sleep from the hard drive upgrade? Found this post stating that if pins 2 and 7 are shorted the issue should be solved.

[url]https://forums.macrumors.com/threads/bypassing-the-hdd-fan-when-installing-an-ssd.1765854/[/url]

Should we try this first or check something else?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
HDD, or LCD temp sensor issue.
Check their connections.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: If both sensors have good connections what should we try next? Replacing HDD sensor?? LCD sensor is brand new

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
HDD sensor can be bypassed, soldering corresponding pin to ground; directly on HDD/SSD connector.
You can also run ASD and see what errors pop up.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Ran ASD and everything surprisingly passed. Tried original hard drive just for testing and fan is still spinning fast while off or sleep.

what should I try next? Not sure how it can be hard drive sensor  since it?s original hard drive is doing same thing.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: Are you 100% sure the LCD temp sensor is OK?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: Yes. The new lcd came with a new one and also tried the original. Fan does same thing with either sensor.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Check all connections between LCD panel and main logic board.
Also test disconnecting the camera.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
All connections to the main logic board are good.

Disconnecting the camera does not make a difference.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: Run HWMonitor and check all temperatures reported.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Ran HW monitor and HDD bay 1 and 2 are reading 130C

From research I have done this model does not use a external thermal sensor like the 27" imac.

What should I try next?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Check around J4530 and U4500 area.
Looks like dedicated protocol is used on J4530.
Check what happens disconnecting it; also try pulling down pin 3.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Fan still fast with it disconnected.

When you say try pulling down pin 3 does that mean run a jumper from pin 3 to ground pin?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Exactly.
You can try it on the other data pin too.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: pins2 and 3 have been shorted to ground but fan still spins fast when off or in sleep

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: anything else I can try? Have a wire connecting pins 1 2 and 3 but fan still fast

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
If thing happened when dropped the screen, should be cable, or connection issue.
Finally, you can use software to control the fan, like Mac Speed Fan.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: How can software help though when it?s turned off or in sleep mode ?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Ooops, fan stays on in sleep an S5 state?
That means 12V_S0 always present.
Check Q7950 for short D-S.
PM_EN_FET_P12V_S0 should go down in S5 and sleep mode.

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Q7950 is not shorted.

What to check next?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: What about voltages on that area?

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: 12.18V on pins 7 and 8 and 0.60 on pins 1 and 2

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: 0.60V pins 1 and 2

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
If you mean Q7950, impossible.
Check schematic, pins 1, 2, 7, 8 are tied togheter!

Post all voltages for Q/U7950.
Yo cannot have 12V on Q7950 output on S5, or sleep mode.
Uneless Q7950 is bad, or U7950 is enabled when souldn't be...

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Q7950 12.20 on all pins

U7950 pin 1 flucates between 0, 11, and 12V pin 2 0V pin 3 0V PIN 4 0.45 pin 8 0V pin 7 11V pin 6 0.135V pin 5 12.20V

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
"Q7950 12.20 on all pins"
Shorted, change it...

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: Where can a replacement Q7950 be ordered? Doesn't seem to be one on any of my donar boards checking schematics and cant find anywhere to buy just Q7950 itself on google

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
I don't remember where I've got them.
Was not easy to find online, probably Aliexpress...

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message: hello i need to know pin to shorted on ssd for bypass fan full speed after ssd upgrade please for this board

title: 820-3302 late 2012 imac fast fan spin
message:
Please open new thread with your problem.
You can do the bypass directly on the SSD, is not related with the iMac MLB.
